62    private static final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(TestTablePermissions.class);
63    private static final HBaseTestingUtility UTIL = new HBaseTestingUtility();
64    private static ZooKeeperWatcher ZKW;
65    private final static Abortable ABORTABLE = new Abortable() {
66      private final AtomicBoolean abort = new AtomicBoolean(false);
67  
68      @Override
69      public void abort(String why, Throwable e) {
70        LOG.info(why, e);
71        abort.set(true);
72      }
73  
74      @Override
75      public boolean isAborted() {
76        return abort.get();
77      }
78    };

81    private static byte[] TEST_TABLE2 = Bytes.toBytes("perms_test2");
82    private static byte[] TEST_FAMILY = Bytes.toBytes("f1");
83    private static byte[] TEST_QUALIFIER = Bytes.toBytes("col1");

116   @Test
117   public void testBasicWrite() throws Exception {
118     Configuration conf = UTIL.getConfiguration();
119     // add some permissions
120     AccessControlLists.addUserPermission(conf,
121             new UserPermission(Bytes.toBytes("george"), TEST_TABLE, null, (byte[])null,
122             UserPermission.Action.READ, UserPermission.Action.WRITE));
123     AccessControlLists.addUserPermission(conf,
124         new UserPermission(Bytes.toBytes("hubert"), TEST_TABLE, null, (byte[])null,
125             UserPermission.Action.READ));
126     AccessControlLists.addUserPermission(conf,
127         new UserPermission(Bytes.toBytes("humphrey"),
128             TEST_TABLE, TEST_FAMILY, TEST_QUALIFIER,
129             UserPermission.Action.READ));
130 
131     // retrieve the same
132     ListMultimap<String,TablePermission> perms =
133         AccessControlLists.getTablePermissions(conf, TEST_TABLE);
134     List<TablePermission> userPerms = perms.get("george");
135     assertNotNull("Should have permissions for george", userPerms);
136     assertEquals("Should have 1 permission for george", 1, userPerms.size());
137     TablePermission permission = userPerms.get(0);
138     assertTrue("Permission should be for " + TEST_TABLE,
139         Bytes.equals(TEST_TABLE, permission.getTable()));
140     assertNull("Column family should be empty", permission.getFamily());
141 
142     // check actions
143     assertNotNull(permission.getActions());
144     assertEquals(2, permission.getActions().length);
145     List<TablePermission.Action> actions = Arrays.asList(permission.getActions());
146     assertTrue(actions.contains(TablePermission.Action.READ));
147     assertTrue(actions.contains(TablePermission.Action.WRITE));
148 
149     userPerms = perms.get("hubert");
150     assertNotNull("Should have permissions for hubert", userPerms);
151     assertEquals("Should have 1 permission for hubert", 1, userPerms.size());
152     permission = userPerms.get(0);
153     assertTrue("Permission should be for " + TEST_TABLE,
154         Bytes.equals(TEST_TABLE, permission.getTable()));
155     assertNull("Column family should be empty", permission.getFamily());
156 
157     // check actions
158     assertNotNull(permission.getActions());
159     assertEquals(1, permission.getActions().length);
160     actions = Arrays.asList(permission.getActions());
161     assertTrue(actions.contains(TablePermission.Action.READ));
162     assertFalse(actions.contains(TablePermission.Action.WRITE));
163 
164     userPerms = perms.get("humphrey");
165     assertNotNull("Should have permissions for humphrey", userPerms);
166     assertEquals("Should have 1 permission for humphrey", 1, userPerms.size());
167     permission = userPerms.get(0);
168     assertTrue("Permission should be for " + TEST_TABLE,
169         Bytes.equals(TEST_TABLE, permission.getTable()));
170     assertTrue("Permission should be for family " + TEST_FAMILY,
171         Bytes.equals(TEST_FAMILY, permission.getFamily()));
172     assertTrue("Permission should be for qualifier " + TEST_QUALIFIER,
173         Bytes.equals(TEST_QUALIFIER, permission.getQualifier()));
174 
175     // check actions
176     assertNotNull(permission.getActions());
177     assertEquals(1, permission.getActions().length);
178     actions = Arrays.asList(permission.getActions());
179     assertTrue(actions.contains(TablePermission.Action.READ));
180     assertFalse(actions.contains(TablePermission.Action.WRITE));
181 
182     // table 2 permissions
183     AccessControlLists.addUserPermission(conf,
184         new UserPermission(Bytes.toBytes("hubert"), TEST_TABLE2, null, (byte[])null,
185             TablePermission.Action.READ, TablePermission.Action.WRITE));
186 
187     // check full load
188     Map<byte[],ListMultimap<String,TablePermission>> allPerms =
189         AccessControlLists.loadAll(conf);
190     assertEquals("Full permission map should have entries for both test tables",
191         2, allPerms.size());
192 
193     userPerms = allPerms.get(TEST_TABLE).get("hubert");
194     assertNotNull(userPerms);
195     assertEquals(1, userPerms.size());
196     permission = userPerms.get(0);
197     assertTrue(Bytes.equals(TEST_TABLE, permission.getTable()));
198     assertEquals(1, permission.getActions().length);
199     assertEquals(TablePermission.Action.READ, permission.getActions()[0]);
200 
201     userPerms = allPerms.get(TEST_TABLE2).get("hubert");
202     assertNotNull(userPerms);
203     assertEquals(1, userPerms.size());
204     permission = userPerms.get(0);
205     assertTrue(Bytes.equals(TEST_TABLE2, permission.getTable()));
206     assertEquals(2, permission.getActions().length);
207     actions = Arrays.asList(permission.getActions());
208     assertTrue(actions.contains(TablePermission.Action.READ));
209     assertTrue(actions.contains(TablePermission.Action.WRITE));
210   }

212   @Test
213   public void testPersistence() throws Exception {
214     Configuration conf = UTIL.getConfiguration();
215     AccessControlLists.addUserPermission(conf,
216         new UserPermission(Bytes.toBytes("albert"), TEST_TABLE, null,
217                            (byte[])null, TablePermission.Action.READ));
218     AccessControlLists.addUserPermission(conf,
219         new UserPermission(Bytes.toBytes("betty"), TEST_TABLE, null,
220                            (byte[])null, TablePermission.Action.READ,
221                            TablePermission.Action.WRITE));
222     AccessControlLists.addUserPermission(conf,
223         new UserPermission(Bytes.toBytes("clark"),
224                            TEST_TABLE, TEST_FAMILY,
225                            TablePermission.Action.READ));
226     AccessControlLists.addUserPermission(conf,
227         new UserPermission(Bytes.toBytes("dwight"),
228                            TEST_TABLE, TEST_FAMILY, TEST_QUALIFIER,
229                            TablePermission.Action.WRITE));
230 
231     // verify permissions survive changes in table metadata
232     ListMultimap<String,TablePermission> preperms =
233         AccessControlLists.getTablePermissions(conf, TEST_TABLE);
234 
235     HTable table = new HTable(conf, TEST_TABLE);
236     table.put(new Put(Bytes.toBytes("row1"))
237         .add(TEST_FAMILY, TEST_QUALIFIER, Bytes.toBytes("v1")));
238     table.put(new Put(Bytes.toBytes("row2"))
239         .add(TEST_FAMILY, TEST_QUALIFIER, Bytes.toBytes("v2")));
240     HBaseAdmin admin = UTIL.getHBaseAdmin();
241     admin.split(TEST_TABLE);
242 
243     // wait for split
244     Thread.sleep(10000);
245 
246     ListMultimap<String,TablePermission> postperms =
247         AccessControlLists.getTablePermissions(conf, TEST_TABLE);
248 
249     checkMultimapEqual(preperms, postperms);
250   }

252   @Test
253   public void testSerialization() throws Exception {
254     Configuration conf = UTIL.getConfiguration();
255     ListMultimap<String,TablePermission> permissions = ArrayListMultimap.create();
256     permissions.put("george", new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE, null,
257         TablePermission.Action.READ));
258     permissions.put("george", new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE, TEST_FAMILY,
259         TablePermission.Action.WRITE));
260     permissions.put("george", new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE2, null,
261         TablePermission.Action.READ));
262     permissions.put("hubert", new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE2, null,
263         TablePermission.Action.READ, TablePermission.Action.WRITE));
264 
265     ByteArrayOutputStream bos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
266     AccessControlLists.writePermissions(new DataOutputStream(bos),
267         permissions, conf);
268 
269     ByteArrayInputStream bis = new ByteArrayInputStream(bos.toByteArray());
270     ListMultimap<String,TablePermission> copy =
271         AccessControlLists.readPermissions(new DataInputStream(bis), conf);
272 
273     checkMultimapEqual(permissions, copy);
274   }
275 
276   public void checkMultimapEqual(ListMultimap<String,TablePermission> first,
277       ListMultimap<String,TablePermission> second) {
278     assertEquals(first.size(), second.size());
279     for (String key : first.keySet()) {
280       List<TablePermission> firstPerms = first.get(key);
281       List<TablePermission> secondPerms = second.get(key);
282       assertNotNull(secondPerms);
283       assertEquals(firstPerms.size(), secondPerms.size());
284       LOG.info("First permissions: "+firstPerms.toString());
285       LOG.info("Second permissions: "+secondPerms.toString());
286       for (TablePermission p : firstPerms) {
287         assertTrue("Permission "+p.toString()+" not found", secondPerms.contains(p));
288       }
289     }
290   }

292   @Test
293   public void testEquals() throws Exception {
294     TablePermission p1 = new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE, null, TablePermission.Action.READ);
295     TablePermission p2 = new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE, null, TablePermission.Action.READ);
296     assertTrue(p1.equals(p2));
297     assertTrue(p2.equals(p1));
298 
299     p1 = new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE, null, TablePermission.Action.READ, TablePermission.Action.WRITE);
300     p2 = new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE, null, TablePermission.Action.WRITE, TablePermission.Action.READ);
301     assertTrue(p1.equals(p2));
302     assertTrue(p2.equals(p1));
303 
304     p1 = new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE, TEST_FAMILY, TablePermission.Action.READ, TablePermission.Action.WRITE);
305     p2 = new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE, TEST_FAMILY, TablePermission.Action.WRITE, TablePermission.Action.READ);
306     assertTrue(p1.equals(p2));
307     assertTrue(p2.equals(p1));
308 
309     p1 = new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE, TEST_FAMILY, TEST_QUALIFIER, TablePermission.Action.READ, TablePermission.Action.WRITE);
310     p2 = new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE, TEST_FAMILY, TEST_QUALIFIER, TablePermission.Action.WRITE, TablePermission.Action.READ);
311     assertTrue(p1.equals(p2));
312     assertTrue(p2.equals(p1));
313 
314     p1 = new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE, null, TablePermission.Action.READ);
315     p2 = new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE, TEST_FAMILY, TablePermission.Action.READ);
316     assertFalse(p1.equals(p2));
317     assertFalse(p2.equals(p1));
318 
319     p1 = new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE, null, TablePermission.Action.READ);
320     p2 = new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE, null, TablePermission.Action.WRITE);
321     assertFalse(p1.equals(p2));
322     assertFalse(p2.equals(p1));
323     p2 = new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE, null, TablePermission.Action.READ, TablePermission.Action.WRITE);
324     assertFalse(p1.equals(p2));
325     assertFalse(p2.equals(p1));
326 
327     p1 = new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE, null, TablePermission.Action.READ);
328     p2 = new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE2, null, TablePermission.Action.READ);
329     assertFalse(p1.equals(p2));
330     assertFalse(p2.equals(p1));
331 
332     p2 = new TablePermission(TEST_TABLE, null);
333     assertFalse(p1.equals(p2));
334     assertFalse(p2.equals(p1));
335   }

337   @Test
338   public void testGlobalPermission() throws Exception {
339     Configuration conf = UTIL.getConfiguration();
340 
341     // add some permissions
342     AccessControlLists.addUserPermission(conf,
343         new UserPermission(Bytes.toBytes("user1"),
344             Permission.Action.READ, Permission.Action.WRITE));
345     AccessControlLists.addUserPermission(conf,
346         new UserPermission(Bytes.toBytes("user2"),
347             Permission.Action.CREATE));
348     AccessControlLists.addUserPermission(conf,
349         new UserPermission(Bytes.toBytes("user3"),
350             Permission.Action.ADMIN, Permission.Action.READ, Permission.Action.CREATE));
351 
352     ListMultimap<String,TablePermission> perms = AccessControlLists.getTablePermissions(conf, null);
353     List<TablePermission> user1Perms = perms.get("user1");
354     assertEquals("Should have 1 permission for user1", 1, user1Perms.size());
355     assertEquals("user1 should have WRITE permission",
356                  new Permission.Action[] { Permission.Action.READ, Permission.Action.WRITE },
357                  user1Perms.get(0).getActions());
358 
359     List<TablePermission> user2Perms = perms.get("user2");
360     assertEquals("Should have 1 permission for user2", 1, user2Perms.size());
361     assertEquals("user2 should have CREATE permission",
362                  new Permission.Action[] { Permission.Action.CREATE },
363                  user2Perms.get(0).getActions());
364 
365     List<TablePermission> user3Perms = perms.get("user3");
366     assertEquals("Should have 1 permission for user3", 1, user3Perms.size());
367     assertEquals("user3 should have ADMIN, READ, CREATE permission",
368                  new Permission.Action[] {
369                     Permission.Action.ADMIN, Permission.Action.READ, Permission.Action.CREATE
370                  },
371                  user3Perms.get(0).getActions());
372   }

374   @Test
375   public void testAuthManager() throws Exception {
376     Configuration conf = UTIL.getConfiguration();
377     /* test a race condition causing TableAuthManager to sometimes fail global permissions checks
378      * when the global cache is being updated
379      */
380     TableAuthManager authManager = TableAuthManager.get(ZKW, conf);
381     // currently running user is the system user and should have global admin perms
382     User currentUser = User.getCurrent();
383     assertTrue(authManager.authorize(currentUser, Permission.Action.ADMIN));
384     for (int i=1; i<=50; i++) {
385       AccessControlLists.addUserPermission(conf, new UserPermission(Bytes.toBytes("testauth"+i),
386           Permission.Action.ADMIN, Permission.Action.READ, Permission.Action.WRITE));
387       // make sure the system user still shows as authorized
388       assertTrue("Failed current user auth check on iter "+i,
389           authManager.authorize(currentUser, Permission.Action.ADMIN));
390     }
391   }
